Package chess

Class Chess

java.lang.Object
chess.Chess
Direct Known Subclasses:
Bishop, Empty, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook
public class Chess
extends java.lang.Object
This is the main class named Chess which is used to run the main program
Author:
Advith Chegu, Banty Patel

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static Chess[][] chess_board
    This field is initializing the size of the chess board to be of object type Chess which is an 8x8 matrix

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Chess()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    private static boolean check()
    This method traverses the board after each turn to check if the board is in a check state
    static boolean checkParameters​(java.lang.String move)
    This method takes in a string of the input and returns a boolean indicating if the input is valid
    static int[] find_indexes​(java.lang.String str)
    This method takes in a string (position on board), and returns the position in the 2D array
    java.lang.String getColor()
    This method is overridden in the chess pieces' classes to return their color (white/black)
    int getCount()
    This method is overridden in the pawn class to get the count of moves that a pawn is out of its original space, which is the count field This field is used to check if an en passant can occur
    java.lang.String getId()
    This method is overridden in the chess pieces' classes to return their ID
    boolean getMoved()
    This method is overridden in the King class to return the value of the field moved
    java.util.ArrayList<int[]> getSpots​(int[] attackerPos, int[] kingPos)
    In the event that king is in check, this method returns the spots between attacker and king
    boolean getTwoStep()
    This method is overridden in the pawn class to get the pawn's boolean field, "two_step", value to see if the pawn had made a 2-step move as it's first move true = performed a 2-step as initial move, false = did not perform the 2-step as it's first move or has not moved yet
    static void initBoard()
    This method is called to initialize the board in the beginning of the program by placing all chess pieces in their correct original position in the chess_board 2D object array we created earlier
    boolean isCheck​(int x, int y)
    This method is used only in the king classes and checks to see if king is in check
    boolean isfirstMove()
    This method is overridden in the pawn class to check whether a specific pawn piece has made it's first move yet true = it is the first move for the pawn, false = not the first move for that pawn
    boolean isValid​(int[] start, int[] destination)
    This method is overridden in the chess pieces' classes to return a boolean to indicate whether the move for that particular piece is valid false = invalid, true = valid
    static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
    This is the main method which is used to run the program
    boolean move_makes_check​(int[] start, int[] dest)
    This method takes in a starting position and destination position and tests to see if that particular move would keep the king in check or put the king in check
    static boolean occupy​(int[] start, int[] destination)
    This method checks to see if a destination is occupied by a team piece true = occupied by a team piece, false = not occupied by a team piece
    static void printBoard()
    This method is called to print the chess_board
    void setCount​(int i)
    This method is overridden in the pawn class to set the count field of a pawn
    void setMoved​(boolean moved)
    This method is overridden in the King class to set the boolean field moved, which indicates whether the king has moved This field is used for the purpose of castling
    void setPawnFirst​(boolean boo)
    This method is overridden in the pawn class to set the pawn's boolean field, "first"
    void setTwoStep​(boolean b)
    This method is overridden in the pawn class to set the pawn's boolean field, "two_step"
    static void updateBoard​(int[] start_indexes, int[] destination_indexes, java.lang.String move)
    This method takes in an array start_indexes which holds the row index and column index starting position at the 0th and 1st index respectively, and takes in an array destination_indexes which holds the row index and column index ending position at the 0th and 1st index respectively, and takes in a boolean used to set the king's and rook's moved boolean field.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • chess_board

      public static Chess[][] chess_board
      This field is initializing the size of the chess board to be of object type Chess which is an 8x8 matrix

  • Constructor Details

    • Chess

      public Chess()

  • Method Details

    • initBoard

      public static void initBoard()
      This method is called to initialize the board in the beginning of the program by placing all chess pieces in their correct original position in the chess_board 2D object array we created earlier

    • getId

      public java.lang.String getId()
      This method is overridden in the chess pieces' classes to return their ID
      Returns:
      String - returns the ID of the chess piece the method is called upon

    • getColor

      public java.lang.String getColor()
      This method is overridden in the chess pieces' classes to return their color (white/black)
      Returns:
      String - return the color of the chess piece the method is called upon

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid​(int[] start, int[] destination)
      This method is overridden in the chess pieces' classes to return a boolean to indicate whether the move for that particular piece is valid false = invalid, true = valid
      Parameters:
      start - - an integer array that holds the row and column starting position of a chess piece in the 0th and 1st index respectively
      destination - - an integer array that holds row and columns destination position of a chess piece in the 0th and 1st index respectively
      Returns:
      boolean - returns a boolean indicating if the move is valid

    • isfirstMove

      public boolean isfirstMove()
      This method is overridden in the pawn class to check whether a specific pawn piece has made it's first move yet true = it is the first move for the pawn, false = not the first move for that pawn
      Returns:
      boolean - returns a boolean indicating if the pawn had moved

    • setPawnFirst

      public void setPawnFirst​(boolean boo)
      This method is overridden in the pawn class to set the pawn's boolean field, "first"
      Parameters:
      boo - - is the boolean value the pawn will set it's field "first" to

    • setTwoStep

      public void setTwoStep​(boolean b)
      This method is overridden in the pawn class to set the pawn's boolean field, "two_step"
      Parameters:
      b - - is the boolean value the pawn will set it's field "two_step" to

    • getTwoStep

      public boolean getTwoStep()
      This method is overridden in the pawn class to get the pawn's boolean field, "two_step", value to see if the pawn had made a 2-step move as it's first move true = performed a 2-step as initial move, false = did not perform the 2-step as it's first move or has not moved yet
      Returns:
      boolean - returns the value of the two_step boolean

    • getCount

      public int getCount()
      This method is overridden in the pawn class to get the count of moves that a pawn is out of its original space, which is the count field This field is used to check if an en passant can occur
      Returns:
      int - the number of moves in which the a pawn has been out of its original place

    • setCount

      public void setCount​(int i)
      This method is overridden in the pawn class to set the count field of a pawn
      Parameters:
      i - - takes in an int of which we want to set the pawn's field count as

    • isCheck

      public boolean isCheck​(int x, int y)
      This method is used only in the king classes and checks to see if king is in check
      Parameters:
      x - - x coordinate of the king's move
      y - - y coordinate of the king's move
      Returns:
      boolean - true if the king is in check

    • setMoved

      public void setMoved​(boolean moved)
      This method is overridden in the King class to set the boolean field moved, which indicates whether the king has moved This field is used for the purpose of castling
      Parameters:
      moved - - takes in a boolean to set the field moved in the King's class

    • getMoved

      public boolean getMoved()
      This method is overridden in the King class to return the value of the field moved
      Returns:
      boolean - return the value of the King's field move

    • getSpots

      public java.util.ArrayList<int[]> getSpots​(int[] attackerPos, int[] kingPos)
      In the event that king is in check, this method returns the spots between attacker and king
      Parameters:
      attackerPos - - Position of the attacking piece
      kingPos - - Position of the King piece
      Returns:
      ArrayList - arraylist of spots between attacker and king

    • move_makes_check

      public boolean move_makes_check​(int[] start, int[] dest)
      This method takes in a starting position and destination position and tests to see if that particular move would keep the king in check or put the king in check
      Parameters:
      start - - starting index of piece
      dest - - ending index of piece
      Returns:
      - boolean indicating if king is in check

    • checkParameters

      public static boolean checkParameters​(java.lang.String move)
      This method takes in a string of the input and returns a boolean indicating if the input is valid
      Parameters:
      move - - String holding the input
      Returns:
      - boolean indicating if the input was valid

    • printBoard

      public static void printBoard()
      This method is called to print the chess_board

    • updateBoard

      public static void updateBoard​(int[] start_indexes, int[] destination_indexes, java.lang.String move)
      This method takes in an array start_indexes which holds the row index and column index starting position at the 0th and 1st index respectively, and takes in an array destination_indexes which holds the row index and column index ending position at the 0th and 1st index respectively, and takes in a boolean used to set the king's and rook's moved boolean field. This method essentially updates the board by moving the pieces to their requested position by the player
      Parameters:
      start_indexes - - int array which holds the starting indexes of a chess piece
      destination_indexes - - int array which holds the destination indexes of a chess piece
      move - - boolean used to set the moved variable for a King or Rook chess piece

    • check

      private static boolean check()
      This method traverses the board after each turn to check if the board is in a check state
      Returns:
      boolean - Indicates if either color king is in checkmate

    • find_indexes

      public static int[] find_indexes​(java.lang.String str)
      This method takes in a string (position on board), and returns the position in the 2D array
      Parameters:
      str - - String which holds a position on the board (Ex. "e2")
      Returns:
      int array - an array that holds the row and column index at the 0th index and 1st index

    • occupy

      public static boolean occupy​(int[] start, int[] destination)
      This method checks to see if a destination is occupied by a team piece true = occupied by a team piece, false = not occupied by a team piece
      Parameters:
      start - - indexes for the starting position of a piece (0:row, 1:column)
      destination - - indexes for the ending position of a piece (0:row, 1:column)
      Returns:
      - boolean to indicate if the destination is occupied by a team piece

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      This is the main method which is used to run the program
      Parameters:
      args - - Arguments given in command line
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException
